Package com.norswap.nanoeth.trees.patricia.memory

Class MemPatriciaNode

java.lang.Object
com.norswap.nanoeth.trees.patricia.memory.MemPatriciaNode
All Implemented Interfaces:
PatriciaNode
Direct Known Subclasses:
MemPatriciaBranchNode, MemPatriciaExtensionNode, MemPatriciaLeafNode
public abstract class MemPatriciaNode
extends Object
implements PatriciaNode
The common interface for all in-memory patricia tree node implementations.

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes
    Modifier and Type Class Description
    static class  MemPatriciaNode.SizeContext
    Passed to encode(com.norswap.nanoeth.trees.patricia.memory.MemPatriciaNode.SizeContext) so that the caller (the parent node) may track the RLP-encoded size of its children without actually needing to call RLP.encode().

    Returns the Merkle root of the Merkle tree rooted at this node.
    abstract MemPatriciaNode remove​(Nibbles keySuffix)
    Returns the transformed node, after removing the entry for the given key suffix (if any), or returns null if the removal of the key means that the node itself must disappear.

    • remove

      public abstract MemPatriciaNode remove​(Nibbles keySuffix)
      Description copied from interface: PatriciaNode
      Returns the transformed node, after removing the entry for the given key suffix (if any), or returns null if the removal of the key means that the node itself must disappear.

      This must handle empty nibble sequences.

      Specified by:
      remove in interface PatriciaNode

    • encode

      public abstract RLP encode​(MemPatriciaNode.SizeContext ctx)
      The implementation of this method together implement the node cap function n and the composition function c (equation 197 and previous in the yellowpaper). The return value of this function is the return of the n function.

      We implement c and n together, because recursion is always done through n (which then calls c). The only time we call c directly is when calling TRIE (the function that returns the Merkle root). In practice this means that this function must keep track of the size of its RLP encoding and return a RLP-encoded hash instead if the size exceeds 32 bytes. This also means that merkleRoot() (which implements the yellowpaper TRIE function) must unwrap the hash in those cases (to avoid double hashing).

      Parameters:
      ctx - must be incremented with the size of the binary encoding of the returned RLP object (see MemPatriciaNode.SizeContext for more details).

    • merkleRoot

      public final MerkleRoot merkleRoot()
      Description copied from interface: PatriciaNode
      Returns the Merkle root of the Merkle tree rooted at this node. This implements the TRIE function in the yellowpaper (equation 195).
      Specified by:
      merkleRoot in interface PatriciaNode
